greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: number of compositions of n into relatively prime summands.
comment: Let R_k(n) be the number of compositions (ordered partitions) of n with k relatively prime parts. We have the following expressions for R:
Recurrence: C(n,k) = Sum_{j=k..n} floor(n/j)*R_k(j) for k > 1 and R_1(j) = delta_j1 (the Kronecker delta).
link: H. W. Gould, Binomial coefficients, the bracket function and compositions with relatively prime summands, Fib. Quart. 2(4) (1964), 241-260.
maple: with(numtheory):R:=proc(n,k) local s,d: s:=0: for d from 1 to n do if irem(n,d)=0 then s:=s+binomial(d-1,k-1)*mobius(n/d) fi od: RETURN(s) : end; seq(seq(R(n,n-k+1),k=1..n-1),n=1..15); R:=proc(n,k) options remember: local j: if k=1 then RETURN(piecewise(n=1,1)) else RETURN(binomial(n,k)-add(floor(n/j)*R(j,k),j=k..n-1)) fi: end; seq(seq(R(n,n-k+1),k=1..n-1),n=1..15); # C. Ronaldo
xref: _Emeric Deutsch_ points out that the mirror-image, A101391, is a better version of this triangle.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
ext: More terms from C. Ronaldo (aga_new_ac(AT)hotmail.com), Dec 28 2004
